document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Palaearctic and Oriental species of the genus Oides Weber, 1801 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Palaearctic and Oriental species of the genus Oides Weber, 1801 (Coleoptera: Chrysomelidae: Galerucinae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Adorium sumatrensis
Blanchard, 1853 : 337
( Indonesia : Sumatra ). New synonymy

Adorium philippinensis
Boheman, 1859 : 175
( Philippines : Mindanao). New synonymy

Oides bakeri
Laboissière, 1925 : 609
( Philippines : Mindanao);
Wilcox, 1971 : 4
(catalogue);
Kimoto, 1990 : 218
(catalogue). New synonymy

Oides ovalis
Laboissière, 1925 : 610
( Philippines );
Wilcox, 1971 : 13
(catalogue);
Kimoto, 1990 : 220
(catalogue). New synonymy

Oides coomani
Laboissière, 1927 : 42
( Vietnam );
Wilcox, 1971 : 7
(catalogue);
Kimoto, 1989 : 37
(as synonym of
O. flava
, synonymy confirmed ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Types .
Adorium flavum
.
Holotype ♀ ( MNHN , by monotypy), labeled: “ Macé / Bengale [p, w, circle label] // A. flavum / Oliv. [h, w] // HOLOTYPE [p, r] // MUSÉUM PARIS [p] / Collection / GÉNERALE [h, w] // design. 1981 / A. VACHON—det. [p, w]”.

Adorium sumatrensis
. Holotype ♀ ( MNHN , by monotypy), labeled: “493 / 41 [h, w] // MUSEUM PARIS / SUMATRA / RADJA BASSA / JACQUINOT 1841 [p, w] // ♀ // HOLOTYPE [p, r] // VIDIT 0 2.1981 [h] / A. VACHON det [p, w] // Musuem Paris [p] / Sumatrensis [h, w]”.

Adorium philippinensis
. Holotype ♂ (left elytron lost, NHRS , by monotypy), labeled: “male aedeagus and two broken antennae glued on the card) //
Manilla
[p, w] // Kinb . [p, w] // Type . [p, w] // Ad. Philippinensis / Bhn., [h, w] // vidit III-1975 . [h] / A. VACHON det [p, w] // 89 [p] / 75 [h, r] // Typus [p, r] // NHRS-JLKB / 0 0 0 0 27150 [p, w]”.

Oides inornata
. Lectotype ♀ ( BMNH ), here designated, labeled: “Kamrup [h, g] //
Oides
/
inornata
/ Baly / Assam [h, b] // Type [p, w, circle label with red border] // SYN- /
TYPE
[p, w, circle label with blue border] // Baly Coll. [p, w] //
Oides flava Olivier 1807
/ =
albicans Duvivier 1884
/ = inornata Baly, 1877 [h] / A. VACHON—det. [p] / 2-1974 [p, w]”. Paralectotype . 1♂ ( BMNH ): “[male aedeagus glued on card] // Sibsagar [h, g] // Baly Coll. [p, w] // SYN- /
TYPE
[p, w, circle label with blue border] //
Oides flava Olivier 1807
/ = inornata Baly 1877 / ♂ dissected on February [h] / A. VACHON—det. [p] 1974 [h, w]”.

. Lectotype ♂ ( RMNH ), here designated, labeled: “[male aedeagus glued on card] //

albicans

Oides
/
albicans
/ type . Duviv. [h, w] // Dr. B. Hagen. / Tandjong Morawa . / Serdang / (N. O. Sumatra ). [p, w] // ♀ [p, w] // ALLOTYPE [p, r] // A. VACHON—det. [p] IV.1977 [h, w] // RMNH Leiden / ex Indo-Austr. / collection [p, w]”.

flavipes

. Holotype ♂ ( IRSB , by monotypy), labeled: “[male aedeagus glued on card] // ♂ [p, w] // Samar / Semper [p, w] // Coll. Chapuis [p, w] [both labels glued on the following label] // Coll. R. I. Sc. N. B. / Philippines [p, y] //

flavida Duvivier 1884
[h] / A. VACHON—det. [p] / V. 1976 [h, w] // HOLOTYPE [p, r]”.

Oides rhabodscelis
. Lectotype ( NHRS , sex undetermined), here designated, labeled: “ Banguey / Ins. Nördl. Borneo / W. Kedenburg [p, w] // rhabodscelis / m. [h, w, blue letters] // Type [p, w] // Typus [p, r] // NHRS-JLKB / 000025263”. Number of paralectotypes are uncertain.

Oides bakeri
. Lectotype ♂ ( ZMUH ), here designated, labeled: “ Davao / Mindanao / Baker [p, w] //
Oides
/ Bakeri m. [h] / V. Laboissière—Dét. [p, w] //
TYPE
[p, w, red letters] // Le Moult vend. / Via Reinbek / Eing. Nr. 1, 1957 [p, w]”. Paralectotype . 1 ex. ( USNM , sex undetermined): “ Davao / Mindanao / Baker [p, w] // 8564 [h, w] //
Oides
/ Bakeri m. [h] / V. Laboissière—Dét. [p, w] //
TYPE
[p, w, red letters] // BLNO / 0 0 2521 [p, b] // USNMENT / 0 0 871281 [p, w]”.

Oides ovalis
. Lectotype ♀ ( ZMUH ), here designated, labeled: “Mt. Makiling / Luzon, Baker [p, w] //
Oides
/
ovalis
m / V. Laboissière—Dét [p, w] //
TYPE
[p, w, red letters] // Le Moult vend. / Via Reinbek / Eing. Nr. 1, 1957 [p, w] // 2427 [h, w]”. Paralecotype. 1 ex. ( USNM , sex undetermined): “Mt. Makiling / Luzon, Baker [p, w] //
Oides
/
ovalis
m / V. Laboissière—Dét [p, w] //
TYPE
[p, w, red letters] // BLNO / 0 0 2676 [p, b] // USNMENT / 0 0 871525 [p, w]”. There should be one more type based on the original descriptions ( Laboissière 1925 ).

Oides coomani
. Lectotype ♀ ( ZMUH ), here designated, labeled: “ Hoa Binh / Tonkin / R P De Cooman [h, w] / / Oides / Coomani m [h] / V. Laboissière—Dét [p, w] //
TYPE
[p, w, red letters] // Le Moult vend. / via Reinbek / Eing. Nr. 1, 1957 [p, w]”. Number of paralectotypes is uncertain.

Diagnosis. Members of this species are similar to those of
O. foveicollis Laboissière
and
O. femoralis Laboissière
with the entirely yellow elytra but can be distinguished by the yellow scutellum and femora (black scutellum and femora in
O. femoralis
) and relatively longer antennomere III (much shorter in
O. foveicollis
).

Distribution. China (?), India , Indonesia ( Bali , Java , Kalimantan , Sumatra ), Laos , East Malaysia , Myanmar , Nepal (?), Philippines , Thailand ( Fig. 37 ). Records from China and Nepal need confirmation because no specimens were available for study.
